Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the player class.
    Version:
    1.0.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player()
      The Player does not take any arguments.
      Player(java.lang.String playerName) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPlayerScore(int playerScore)
      This method adds a value to a specific player's score.
      static Player findPlayer(int playerID)
      Returns the specific player with the specified ID.
      int getPlayerID()
      Returns the player ID of a specific player.
      java.lang.String getPlayerName()
      Returns the player name of a specific player.
      int getPlayerScore()
      Returns the score of a specific player.
      static java.util.List<Player> getPlayersList()
      Returns a list of all registered players.
      static void reset()
      Resets the players list and the playerCount variables.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String playerName)

      • Player

        public Player()
        The Player does not take any arguments. When constructing a new player, the new player will automatically get added to the players list (a list of all the players).

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayerScore

        public int getPlayerScore()
        Returns the score of a specific player.
        Returns:
        int

      • addPlayerScore

        public void addPlayerScore(int playerScore)
        This method adds a value to a specific player's score.
        Parameters:
        playerScore - the wanted value that has to be added to the player.

        public int getPlayerID()
        Returns the player ID of a specific player.

        public java.lang.String getPlayerName()
        Returns the player name of a specific player.
        Returns:
        String

      • findPlayer

        public static Player findPlayer(int playerID)
        Returns the specific player with the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        playerID - the ID of the wanted player
        Returns:
        Player

      • getPlayersList

        public static java.util.List<Player> getPlayersList()
        Returns a list of all registered players.
        Returns:
        List of Player objects

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        Resets the players list and the playerCount variables.
